content: I downloaded the zip file of ballot spreadsheets, but I can't see one that looks like it is for the FHIRPath ballot. If it is there, what is its file name?
There's a code for each ballot that you can see on the ballot desktop. Any of the ones that start with FHIR should work for you

I do not see codes on the ballot desktop. Each row of "Ballot Consensus Groups in which you ARE Participating" contains a link to the same ZIP file, which contains 44 spreadsheets. I thought were were supposed to pick the spreadsheet that corresponded to the ballot we were reviewing. I found spreadsheets for the other ballots I'm reviewing, but not for FHIRPath.
@Lynn Laakso - what's the best way for a balloter to figure out which spreadsheet to use?
It should be the one whose name matches the unique ballot id. BUt I often get them mucked up. FHIRPath has NMN in the ballot id, for its historical name of "Neutral Mapping Notation"
Is that something that can be fixed going forward?
Certainly, if I remember to do it...
Thanks, I see the NMN one. I guess I also could have found it by searching on file contents rather than just the file names.
